sentence.Network_en: If you leave your car there, the police will impound it.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果你把汽车停放在那儿, 警察就会把它扣押.

sentence.Network_en: I'll need to write you a ticket and impound your vehicle.
sentence.Network_cn: 我必须开罚单给你,并且扣留你的车子.

sentence.Network_en: We'll need to impound your car.

entry.def: If something is impounded by policemen, customs officers or other officials, they officially take possession of it because a law or rule has been broken.

example.ex: The ship was impounded under the terms of the UN trade embargo...
example.tran: 该船因触犯联合国贸易禁运条款而被扣押。

example.ex: The police moved in, arrested him and impounded the cocaine.
example.tran: 警察冲进去将他拘捕并没收了可卡因。

means.word_mean: 1. take temporary possession of as a security, by legal authority;

sentences.sentence: "The customs agents impounded the illegal shipment"

means.word_mean: 2. place or shut up in a pound;

sentences.sentence: "pound the cows so they don't stray"

auth_sentence.content: The executive also had the authority to impound money already appropriated.
auth_sentence.res_content: The executive also had the authority to impound money already appropriated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The executive also had the authority to impound money already appropriated.

auth_sentence.content: Sony was also seeking to impound his "circumvention devices," and it wanted him to take all the instructions offline immediately.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sony was also seeking to impound his "circumvention devices," and it wanted him to take all the instructions offline immediately.

means.word_mean: 依法没收, 扣押(某物)

sentences.en: The vehicle was impounded as part of the police investigation.
sentences.cn: 这辆车作为警务调查的一部份被扣押了。

sentences.en: The police had come to my house and impounded all my belongings.
sentences.cn: 警察曾到我家没收了我所有的财物。
